alert.note: Alert for Phillips (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 28 at 10:09PM MDT until June 29 at 1:15AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: The National Weather Service in Denver has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Phillips County in northeastern Colorado... * Until 115 AM MDT. * At 1009 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, gulches, roads, and poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Haxtun, Paoli and Fairfield. This includes the following streams and drainages... Wildhorse Creek, Sandy Creek and North Fork Frenchman Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
